Device Generator¶

The DeviceGenerator Module generates a list of devices based on the information in the config file: Number of devices, their positions, their resources, etc.

Links are established either using proximity, extrapolating from possible Wi-Fi connectivity between devices, or from the information provided in the input files.

It then generates a Routing Table for the shortest single path between each device based on the links between them.

Finally, information is exported to an output folder, which defaults to latest/devices.json.

Usage:

python3 DeviceGenerator.py
DeviceGenerator.main()

Runs the core loop for the program: loads the configuration after a call to the argument parser, generates the devices, outputs to the destination file, and logs all operations.

DeviceGenerator.parse_args()

Parses the arguments from the configuration, and generates a –help subcommand to assist the user.

Returns:

Parsed command line arguments.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

App Generator¶

The AppGenerator Module performs a complete deployment test on 200 applications over 40 devices.

Usage:

python3 AppGenerator.py

AppGenerator.main()

Runs the core loop for the program: loads the configuration after a call to the argument parser, generates the applications, outputs to the destination file, and logs all operations.

AppGenerator.parse_args()

Parses the arguments from the configuration and generates a –help subcommand to assist the user.

Returns:

Parsed command line arguments.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

Placement Generator¶

The PlacementGenerator Module performs a complete deployment test on 200 applications over 40 devices.

Usage:

python3 PlacementGenerator.py

PlacementGenerator.main()

Runs the core loop for the program: loads the configuration after a call to the argument parser, generates the placements, outputs to the destination file, and logs all operations.

PlacementGenerator.parse_args()

Parses the arguments from the configuration and generates a –help subcommand to assist the user.

Returns:

Parsed command line arguments.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

Visualization¶

The Visualize Module performs a complete deployment test on 200 applications over 40 devices.

Usage:

python3 Visualize.py

Visualizer.main()

Runs the core loop for the program: loads the configuration after a call to the argument parser, imports the results, and generates visualizations.

Visualizer.parse_args()

Parses the arguments from the configuration and generates a –help subcommand to assist the user.

Returns:

Parsed command line arguments.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace
